author: Stephen Hayward
title: Young couple buy Britain's cheapest house - paying just £1 for council property
text:
Council are offering homes for just £1 after investing £30,000 in dilapidated two-bedroom homes (Photo: NORTH WEST NEWS SERVICE) Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing! Could   
A young couple have bagged Britain’s cheapest house after buying their first home for just £1. 
For less than the price of two first class stamps, Rebecca Dennis and Chris Benn purchased their first home together and have spent the last four months doing it up. 
The Sunday People understands that the property is now believed to be worth £60,000 and the pair are on the property ladder eight years earlier than the average Brit. 
Rebecca and Chris of Stoke on Trent, were thrilled when they landed a place on Stoke-on-Trent city council’s home ownership scheme which offers residents the chance to buy a house for £1. Read More Depth of housing crisis revealed as 35,000 people sit on waiting lists for 10 YEARS The street on which Rebecca and Chris live (Photo: NORTH WEST NEWS SERVICE) 
After they paid in their initial single digit deposit, the council invested £30,000 in the dilapidated two bedroom mid-terrace. 
And Rebecca and Chris will pay the loan back over the next ten years until they own the house outright. 
The council’s bid to rejuvenate run-down areas requires prospective buyers to live in the house for at least five years and have a household income of between £18,000 to £25,000. 
But in order to qualify, one of the couple also had to have a work contract guaranteeing 16 hours a week. £1 is all it costs to buy a property on the street (Photo: Getty Images) 
Because Chris, 22, is an independent contractor, his full-time job in a car factory didn’t fit the bill. 
So despite Rebecca being a full-time photography student at Staffordshire University, she took on a new job with longer hours at a supermarket to make sure they qualified. 
Rebecca, 21, who also works in a teddy bear shop and as a photographer’s assistant said: “It’s a dream come true to have a house of our own. The £1 price tag is a special bonus! 
“We really had to fight for it - even though it meant me taking on my third job and upping my hours it was totally worth it.” Like us on Facebook
